name: Bali Bamboo Jungle Huts and Hostel
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja No.11, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
I stayed at Bali Bamboo Jungle Huts in Ubud and had an amazing time. The food was really tasty, and the vibe there was awesome. The owners, Sri and Bumbum were super friendly and made us feel like part of the family.

The hostel is a bit far from the main part of Ubud, but I actually liked that. It was nice and quiet, away from all the hustle and bustle. Plus, the view from the pool was just gorgeous!

One thing I loved was how easy it was to socialize. Whether by the pool or in the common areas, it felt like everyone was open to making friends.

Overall, I loved my stay at Bali Bamboo !  Great food, cool atmosphere, stunning pool view, easy socializing, and a peaceful location. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Ubud
review 2: We loved it. The owners are so lovely! The hostel is located 10km away from the busy city. Therefore it is very peaceful and there are a lot of nice ricefields abd waterfalls. The hostel provides many activities so as cooking classes, sunrise hiking on Mount Batur, jewelry making classes and many more. We loved every bit of our stay in the hostel.
review 3:
From the moment I arrived, I was warmly welcomed by the incredible hosts, Sri and Bum Bum. Their kindness, friendliness, and eagerness to help made my stay truly unforgettable.

The hostel itself was impeccably clean and spacious, offering a comfortable atmosphere for relaxation and socializing. The highlight of the property was undoubtedly the swimming pool, which overlooked a picturesque rice field.

The hostel boasts a prime location, making it convenient to explore the surrounding area.

Don't hesitate to book a few nights in this hostel if your seeking for a peaceful stay.
review 4: Very friendly owners and helpful staff. We stayed for two nights. There were many backpackers during our stay, so it was easy to make friends. The landlady helped us book the Mt Batu sunrise climb and woke up at 2am to cook us breakfast. Highly recommend
review 5: Awesome hostel to stay at. Fun friendly vibes with nice jungle hut rooms. The pool was amazing and the location was great for waterfalls, temples and rice fields.

name: Semara Ratih by Delodsema Village
address: Delodsema Village, Jl. Taman Gajah, Taro, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
A perfect place to have breakfast with a view! You have to pay for the entry tickets for only 10k and I think it's a fair price looking at the beautiful view it offers. You can also pray/"melukat" on the river below the cafe.

The food and beverage is good, my best pick is the Ayam Geprek & Fried Pineapples for the food and the smoothies/juices for the drinks.
review 2: We went there and it’s closed even though online it says it’s one - looks kind of abandoned, but the nature is beautiful though.
review 3: Immersed in a bamboo forest you can find this hidden jewel! 10k irp to enter, you can go all the way down with your motorbike. Food is amazing and view of the wild jungle really breathtaking! There is a duck living in the koi pond, super cute. The garden in the surrounding is nice to visit with all its terraces, temples, waterfalls and statues.
review 4:
Sooo delicious!
We took noodle soup and noodles with teriyaki chicken and it tasted like heaven.
Also try fresh juices, especially orange one - you will be surprised 😉
review 5: Hidden gem. Certainly worth a visit. Very affordable and delicious food options.

name: MIRAH Guest House
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja No.10, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
types: guest_house, hostel, hotel, lodging, restaurant, food
review 1:
Mirah Guest House deserves a solid 5-star rating for its excellent value and charm. This quaint resort, situated about 20-25 minutes outside of downtown Ubud, offers a delightful experience in traditional Balinese style.

The property features 8-10 well-maintained guest houses amidst beautifully landscaped surroundings. One of the highlights for me was enjoying the complimentary breakfast with a stunning cliffside view overlooking the lush forest and valley below.

The staff at Mirah Guest House were incredibly friendly and accommodating. They made arranging massages and other activities effortless, enhancing our overall stay.

If you're looking for a peaceful retreat away from the hustle of downtown Ubud, I highly recommend Mirah Guest House for its serene ambiance, attentive service, and great value. A truly memorable experience!
review 2: We stay here whenever we get up the mountain to escape the heat. It is such a beautiful and peaceful place.  It is small enough to be social and friendly yet you also have abundant privacy. Always a refreshing stay.
review 3: Beautiful, peaceful place to stay. Room was very clean and had everything we needed. Food served in the restaurant is good quality, you can choose where you want to eat, we mostly ate on the terrace with a beautiful view. Garden and space outside our room was also very clean and well maintained, it was a pleasure to spend time there.
review 5:
Real jungle setting with super comfortable everything and animal-loving staff!

I always stay at Mirah Guesthouse when I am in the area. It is an extraordinarily calm, beautiful spot, the facilities are top notch,  with delightful decor and everything is very well maintained, and the staff are some of most kind and helpful I have found in Bali.

I am shocked to read the reviews complainning about the animals there, the EAGLE IS A RESCUE that they found in a horrible condition and have been nurturing it back to health!!!! I saw photos of the poor bird as it was when they found it- it's wings barely had any feathers left!!! Now the bird is thriving!

The small dog in the cage is very well cared for and given lots of love by everyone there, and IS NOT locked in its cage all day!!!

The only time the cage is locked is at night to protect the dog from jungle animals and prevent him from running into the street.

The little guy does not like being on a leash at all so his many daily walks are in full freedom and he often goes back to his cage himself once he is tuckered out.

Like all dogs, he is not allowed to run fully free all the time. take it easy with the panic folks!!

Best to ask people directly- find out what is going before making rash assumptions and harmful statements from behind your phone screen!!

name: Bali Jungle Resort
address: Br, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
The resort is an introverted heaven. It's quiet and peaceful with the sounds of bird chirping, monkey, wind and the water surrounding you at all times. The weather is also nice and cool being amongst the trees, such a breath of fresh air away from the usual hot weather of Bali. The resort also has a private access to nearby river that has a small waterfall, it's refreshing to walk down this path in the morning. A nice resort amidst the jungle indeed, it lives up to its name.
Service is pretty nice despite it being a little understaffed for such a big place. It's not perfect, but workers there tried their best to give you a very pleasant stay and it shows :) although the choice is quite limited, the food is pretty decent here & communication is easy through whatsapp.
Make sure you have a skilled driver with you because the access to this hidden gem is pretty challenging.
review 2: Lovely place! Highly recommend you to stay here! Guys at the front desk were extremely helpful and nice! Food was very tasty!
review 3: The staff is incredibly polite and friendly. However, while the rooms are spacious, they have a significant mold issue. Our main concern was the kitchen; the food hygiene left much to be desired. We encountered numerous bugs in our meals. Even though our room came with breakfast included, we opted to dine at other restaurants. Overall, it was a unique experience.
review 4: Such a place for relaxing,in the middle of jungle. The place is very nice to stay along but the road to get there is challenging. Amazing to spent days in here.
review 5: I think I really regret booking this room. We booked 2 rooms at the last hour with the rain coming down, so many reptiles inside. We paid IDR 1 million with agoda discount for 2 rooms. There was no ac and when we checked in the receptionist seemed confused we booked 2 rooms. Then they gave us the remaining room. It was a bad experience, we regret😢

name: the nenggala suite
address: br. ked, Taro, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
the best of the center of the island.

excellent facilities, natural beauty, and the best: a wonderful group of people who care about all the details so that you have the best rest.

As if that were not enough, they planned and made a storybook wedding come true for me and my husband in just 3 days. many thanks for everything.
review 2: Very nice place with very friendly stuff. Location 30-40min from Ubud need a car or scooter to get around. On site good food, peace and quiet. High speed internet connection, massages (spa). The place is most suitable for a longer stay.
review 3:
We booked this villa for 10 days! This one was the 3rd villa for us in Bali and I can say that it was the best so far! The manager his wife and the personnel were so kindly friendly and always with a smile on their face ready to help us with everything!
I highly recommend The Nenggala Suite!
review 4:
Best stay we have had on Bali.
Staff was great, place is a great hideout, absolutely amazing room. View from the room. And the are with pool. Simply amazing.
You can also rent a scooter (you might need one to get around)
Incredible, Terima kasih.
review 5:
Had an amazing stay here for a week. Beautiful views from the upper floor and excellent service from staff. Be are aware it's a good 30 mins from Ubud and there's not much around in terms of restaurants and grab delivery. That being said, the food on site was great and they do provide a shuttle to town and back every day if you need it.

Excellent place to unplug or check out sebatu waterfall temple nearby.

name: Uma Linggah Resort
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: I don‘t understand how this place can have so many good reviews. The place is just next to a pig farm and there is a lot of loud noise which makes it hard to sleep at night and relax during the day. Furthermore there is no warm water, our bathroom had a very strong bad smell and worst of all we had bed bugs in our bed and ants all over the room. When checking out early to go to another hotel they also refused to give us any refund, even partial refund if they can rent out the room to someone else for the remaining days.
review 2: Various fruit and shower items are provided in the room.  Breakfast is not a buffet, but the menu is very well presented.  The bedding is clean.  The swimming pool has a swing, a small hydromassage tub, and a peaceful view of the rice fields.
review 3: Rooms here are big. And the staff here are so polite and humble. We stayed here for one night. Only the thing here is that dont eat food inside the room because insects will come and you will be not able to sleep at night. So dont eat food inside room. Rest i highly recommend stay here as its nearby swings and rice terrace. The nature of employees is too good.
review 4: Staff here is so nice. They deserve a medal for how nice they were to us and they granted us ever wish we asked for!
review 5:
Staying here in a lumbung type room. The room is spacious, clean, cool, have smart tv, and comfortable. The breakfast is well presented and tastes good. The hot water works well, though it's a bit weak if both the shower and bathtub are on at the same time. The pool is also clean with a nice view. The staff is friendly, and we got a welcome drink too.

The downside is that there were spiders, small cockroaches, and bed bugs (possibly due to being close to the rice fields). If you encounter these, you can ask the staff to help clean. At night, you can hear small squirrels jumping on the roof.

Overall, the accommodation is good, comfortable, with a very pleasant ambiance. Recommended.

name: Warung Semara Ratih , Taro Village
address: Taro, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1:
One of the best food we have had on Bali. Its a little harder to get there. But it is well worth it. You pay 10k for entry to the village. Thats absolutely amazing place and you can stop here for food and enjoy the great atmosphere.
Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Area 11/10
review 2:
This is an amazing place for having food surrounded by nature.
We came here twice in a row, it definitely worth a visit, tasty food, friendly stuff a'd reasonable price.
review 3: It’s one of the hidden place that we explored on the recommendation and the Indonesian  food was purely amazing and had amazing natural rustic feel to the place and also you can visit elephants park near by
review 4: An absolutely stunning place, I wish I could spend half a day here. Getting there by motor bike is a challenge using google map as some of the roads are broken and going up and down hills. The entrance you would pay to the warubg is 10k and they serve rathee cheap food and drink.
review 5: Absolutely gorgeous place..stunning scenery and nature. I don't understand why there was no one else there. Well worth trip from Ubud. The Nasi Goreng was one of best we've had and also the cheapest. Be careful with Google maps it brought us in from the East along broken roads. Go in from the West the road with Padma resort.

name: Bali Coconut House
address: Delodsema Village, Jl. Taman Gajah, Taro Kelod, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: It's a cool place with a lot of culture and chickens around. Very hospitable hosts. We definitely recommend it to those who wish to stay away from the city and grab some local culture. The food options are really limited though and not to everyone's taste. Mind it. But it sinks in the friendly atmosphere and the beautiful surroundings
review 2: Super serene location if you like being away from the urban buzz. One of a kind in Bali! But wrongly advertised as Tegallalang in their Airbnb, this is Taro Village. The host was kind and helpful.
review 3: A really beautiful place. Very hospitable hosts. We stayed here with our two kids. They loved the Koi fish and the loft bed. I would recommend this place if you’d like to get away from the busy areas. Bagus sekali.
review 4:
This is actually the best staycation villa near ubud, around 20 mins.
I was staying for a day with 5 other persons.
The hosts are friendly, the place is good and nice, very clean and lovely. You can bring your family just to spend time there.

name: Rizières
address: J72Q+6FM, Sebatu, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali, Indonesia

name: Konstantin Bamboo Forest
address: Bamboo Forest, Taro, Kec. Tegallalang, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
A little piece of heaven on earth!
No person in sight, only nature.
Worth the trip from a busy ubud.
review 2: We came here because of recommendations but somehow didn't find much. Just a restaurant and a river 🙄

name: Ack Fried Chicken
address: H7XQ+67J, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: You're typical KFC look alike.  Good fried chicken.
review 2: When you stay far from the Denpasar, this one is a good option when you in doubt.
review 3: Very bad, do not go here

name: Bubu Beach
address: H7XQ+PFJ, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Beautiful but you can skip it. But, if you want to take a dip you can at this place because it’s empty if you reach around 10-11 AM
review 2: Beautiful hidden spot within the bamboo forest to refresh and enjoy nature!
review 3: Beautiful little beach near the river!

name: Uma Linggah Resto
address: Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: Very good meal and very kind owner. We found this restaurant during our road trip and it's a beautiful discover

name: BLLI BUT,Mie Ayam Bakso Ayam
address: H7XQ+GFF, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 2: The best soup in Bali I ever had. And I am not even a big soup fan but this was really very good.
review 3: Very nice bakso. The best I have had yet!
review 4: Just found balinese meat ball shop... Taste good
review 5: Busy place with great mie ayam (noodle soup with chicken) - super tasty and good price!

name: Daka Es Teler
address: H7WQ+J42, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Rice fields
address: H7VQ+3FV, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Ben Geprek
address: H7WQ+P3Q, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

name: Warung Makan Pan Oky
address: H7XQ+GC5, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
review 1: The babi guling with lawar here has been the best we've had in Ubud! Stop by here for a quick, delicious meal. The staff here is friendly and welcoming.
review 2: Very cheap, yet very delicious. One of the best stop from kintamani to gianyar.

name: TEGELLALANG
address: H7WQ+V5X, Sebatu, Tegallalang, Gianyar Regency, Bali, Indonesia

name: Warung Campursari Bu Agung
address: H7XQ+36V, Jl. Raya Pujung Kaja, Sebatu, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia
